channel.title: Just putting it out there
channel.description:
kryptix has the best server tbh, all others dont have enough community so theres very little pking going on and pointless training also becuz they get shutdown eventually when lukes has just gone on and on. why dont we all just play 1 server thats decent so the rsc community is bigger and all together not wasting time? its not big enough to spread out.. it used to be alil bigger but its like we dont even have 300 players anymore.
looking forward to rscd tbh.

item.title: Just putting it out there
item.dc:creator: @NoLives NoLives
item.description:
@NoLives wrote:

Luke, I’m hoping you start RSCD off a little different.
We all know why RSCE is a “success” right now.
Just make sure you don’t make the same mistakes you made with RSCE and it’ll be a hit, of course taking into consideration what you’ve told us about the fixes it’ll have.

Read full topic

item.title: Just putting it out there
item.dc:creator: @D.Shark D.Shark
item.description:
@D.Shark wrote:

The fact is Kryptix is winning, simple as. In a world of coders Kryptix is succeeding with a business mind, if people can’t play ‘the game’ there’s no point sitting here complaining all day. It’s not a fair world, I think we all understand that.

Read full topic

item.title: Just putting it out there
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Kryptix:

[quote author=-Nothing link=topic=545541.msg3999079#msg3999079 date=1337705211]Every server starts like that, it’s a different story if they are ever be able to afford that protection of atleast 1GBps. My incomes are like 700€ a month, and it leaves me about 200€ after paying all the bills.

So how do you think we managed it?[/quote]
I thought that you managed it pretty much the way u said it, theres no other way unless you are from rich family/have a good job…

Read full topic

item.title: Just putting it out there
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

-Nothing:

Every server starts like that, it’s a different story if they are ever be able to afford that protection of atleast 1GBps. My incomes are like 700€ a month, and it leaves me about 200€ after paying all the bills.

So how do you think we managed it? We didn’t invest anything at the start, people loved the server and was upset with it being down all the time, so I made an announced explaining the situation and giving my word that their investment wouldn’t be wasted. People believed me and I had enough to scrape together a Staminus server which still went down. Coped with downtime now and again until we introduced subscriptions and then it paid for itself. When we were paying a fortune a month for the huge attacks I’d help out by doing random web tasks to earn a bit of extra cash to invest.

Read full topic

item.title: Just putting it out there
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Every server starts like that, it’s a different story if they are ever be able to afford that protection of atleast 1GBps. My incomes are like 700€ a month, and it leaves me about 200€ after paying all the bills.

Btw, why nobody has bought Staminus cloud servers? They can easily run RSC:
http://www.staminus.net/CLOUD-PRICING

Read full topic

item.title: Just putting it out there
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

imabeast:

I agree kryptix has a decent server, only reason I won’t play it again is he could care less about the actual community he has, I played for a good 6-7 months and he never logged on to talk or chat to anyone, he would simple shout “currently processing subs, paypal = xxxxxxxxx” then log out for a few days, sometimes my subs and many others wouldn’t get processed for 10+ days and when you questioned him about it you most likely got muted for 2 hours etc

I’ve seen RSCE as a lost cause for a very long time now and the thought of investing more time than I already have to improve it seems silly when I could be investing my time into RSCD. I don’t get much time to work on stuff any more so when I do I’d sooner get RSCD closer to being ready. All previous servers have been incredibly flawed and held together by a dangling piece of string. We want RSCD to be a lot more focused, organised and fair so people can’t complain about abuse, bots, lag, etc.

-Nothing:

Or maybe some just don’t have thousands of dollars in their pocket to afford DDoS protected dedicated server. Probably the #1 reason there’s not many servers out other than RSCE.

RSCE started with a bodged together Project P2P source being hosted on a PC with every exploit going and $0 funding though.

Read full topic
